subject: Fashion
title: Garment Worker Wages Worldwide
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Garment Worker Wages Worldwide.

hook.text: A garment worker in Bangladesh earns about $95 a month. A living wage there is roughly $450.

buildup.text: Brands don't set wagesâ€”they set the price per garment, and suppliers squeeze workers to meet it.

discovery.text: In most garment countries, the minimum wage covers only 20-40% of what a family actually needs.

twist.text: When brands boast about paying minimum wage, they're celebrating a wage designed to keep people poor.

climax.text: A living wage would add just 1-3% to the retail price. Brands could afford it. Most choose not to.

punchline.text: Minimum wage isn't a living wage. The gap is the profit.

quiz.question: How much would paying garment workers a living wage add to the retail price of clothing?
